content: basic ribbed sock using magic loop by melissa beyer knittymelissa on ravelry two sizes small medium gauge 8 sts = 1 inch in stockinette materials 100g fingering weight yarn us size 1 circular needle or size needed for gauge stitch markers tapestry needle abbreviations & definitions rs = right side ws = wrong side pm = place marker k = knit p = purl photo and pattern testing credit to princessbren sl1 = slip one stitch as if to purl p2tog = purl two stitches together ssk = slip slip knit slip next stitch as if to knit also slip the second stitch as if to knit pass both stitches purl- wise back to left-hand needle knit both together through the back loop sole = bottom of foot instep = top of foot instructions cast on 64 72 stitches long tail or german twisted long tail cast on recommended pull cable through the midpoint of the stitches 32 36 stitches on each needle tip cuff & leg join in the round being careful not to twist *k2 p2 repeat from * around continue k2 p2 ribbing for 6 inches or your desired leg length note you may opt to knit 1-2 of ribbing followed by several inches of stockinette all knits before starting the heel rather than knit the entire leg ribbed heel flap the heel flap is worked over the first 32 36 stitches only this will be your sole the remaining stitches will become your instep or top of the foot and are unworked for now row 1 rs *sl1 k1 repeat from * across ending with a k1 turn row 2 ws sl1 p to end turn repeat row 1 & 2 until heel flap measures 2 25 2 5 ending with a ws row note how many row you worked in total for the heel flap turn heel row 1 rs sl1 k18 20 ssk k1 turn work note not all heel flap stitches will have been worked row 2 ws sl1 p7 7 p2tog p1 turn row 3 rs sl1 k to one stitch before the gap ssk using one stitch from either side of gap k1 turn row 4 ws sl1 p to one stitch before the gap p2tog using one stitch from either side of gap p1 turn repeat row 3 & 4 until all heel stitches have been worked you will now be ready to work a right side row gussets sl1 k half of heel stitches pm to mark the beginning of the round k remaining heel stitches using sole/heel needle pick up and knit in the slipped stitches down the side of your heel flap you will pick up and knit one stitch for every slipped stitch on the edge of the flap which should be half the total number of heel flap row for example if you knit 32 row for the heel flap you will pick up 16 sts pick up one additional stitch between the heel flap
